status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-5901] Eastern Countries // Transaction type isse
item.description:
The transaction type is always i20 for HU and CZ.
It should be i21,i22,i23,i24

Test Users:
distrelec.testing+cz2@gmail.com
PW: distrelec

distrelec.testing+hu1@gmail.com
PW: distrelec

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: The problem was that we take the country of the sales organization not the country of the CMS site. Since the country of the salesOrg is Austria, then we always get the configurations of AT.

attachment.name: 2014-12-03 10_46_33-Explorer_ Florian Bühler@q-hybris.datwyler.biz_master_ Movex Order - hybris Mana.jpg
attachment.author: fbuehler

item.title: [DISTRELEC-5893] Basic Webtrekk-configuration Eastern-Countries
item.description:
Hi

Please verify the attached screenshot.

  • Variables do not resolve properly
  • "at-" -> required: "ro" (analogous for CZ and HU)

Thx Mark

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: FYI: Is a 'blocker' for any further Webtrekk-testings. Mark

Incorrect values sent by the BackEnd

wtOrderConfirmationContentId -> '$config-webtrekk.domain.distrelec_RO/'
wtContentId -> '$config-webtrekk.domain.distrelec_RO/'
wtTrackId -> '$config-webtrekk.id.distrelec_RO'
wtDomain -> '$config-webtrekk.domain.distrelec_RO'
wtContentGroup -> 'at-ro'

Hi Ruben,

There were some configuration problem with webtrekk properties for HU, RO, CZ, SK sites.

This has been corrected now. Please retest it once again.

Thanks

item.title: [DISTRELEC-5887] Product information get mixed up on SERP when products have long technical attributes
item.description:
When products have long technical descriptions, the product informations of adjoining products get mixed up, i.e. the information of the first is displayed in the display area of the next one.

http://www.distrelec.de/search?q=2014_X_Mas_IT&log=internal&removetitle=true
item.summary: Product information get mixed up on SERP when products have long technical attributes

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Hi Daniela,
I don't see any problem in the display.
Please see attachment. Test again, could be a cache issue.
Thanks

item.title: [DISTRELEC-4812] Product Detail Page: Offers need to be reflected on product detail pages
item.description:
D.05 - There is an offer ("Angebot") claimed on the detail page but it is not clear what the offer is. There is no new price, bundle or something similar clearly visible to the user.

Solution:
As soon as it will be technically possible to gather all the relevant information (e.g. old price, bundle information, etc), the kind of offer the customer gets should be displayed on the detail page, too. E.g. Display an old/new price or use a more detailed badge which makes clear what the offer is.
item.summary: Product Detail Page: Offers need to be reflected on product detail pages

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Estimation: See ticket DISTRELEC-4807 (assumption: both done at once)

What do you think about the following option (Screenshot)?

This should be changed on all discount price relevant pages:

  • Detailpage
  • Compare
  • Cart

I would suggest we'll use the same grey as on the cart page.

I think it also affects the carpet (although it is solved there design-wise), the carousel and the search result page and was, as far as the usability report was concerned, mainly about special discounts on single products for B2C and logged-out customers (rather than cusotmer-specific price lists). As for the change on the detail page it looks like a straightforward adaptation.

We never have discount prices on the search result page and I never see two different prices in the carousel.
So it won't be necessary there.

But the tag "Angebot" is also visible on the search result page and there the customer should ideally already get the information on what the offer is (cf. screenshot from Conrad). The same goes for carousels.

Hi Daniela,

  • It is not possible to show the special prices in the search because we don't know them there.
  • We would need a redesign of the carousel because we never showed any "Your prices" there.

I would suggest we start on the detail page to have it implemented as soon as possible.

Please test after the next deployment
Thanks
